textBox.richText: Jazomics - First recordings, released on the web

We, the Jazzomics, a ragtagle conglomeration of anisotropic jazz tomfoolery, recorded some tracks. It’s a bit loose to say the least, but we had fun doing it. A bunch of kids from the international school in Dresden were there to help us out for the first couple of tracks, notably “Back to Texas” - fully improvised, with yours truly parping away on cornet, instead of the bass (which I’m mostly playing wrong on the later tracks). Here’s the link to the new Jazzonics page with the Mp3s to download and upset your dog/cat/granny with: Jazzomics homepage above picture: detail from Le Clown - Jazz, by Henri Matisse. Jazz Clown? Enough said.
